skillTree.localised_description: As it turns out, the more important the murder, the more likely they are to be carrying something worth 'appropriating'.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: By its very nature, being good at killing requires that you are equally adept at not dying.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

Enemy Hero action success chance: -15%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
With almost un-Skaven-like focus, Snikch moves unseen through the battlefield until the moment of murderous truth.
All races have moments of weakness – times when their back is turned and their friends are looking the wrong way.

effects.description:
Enemy units are afflicted with temporary defensive penalties at the beginning of ambush battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Eshin Assassins are experts are exploiting the briefest vulnerabilities. Bursting out of the darkness to end lives with uncanny skill.
"You are already kill-dead, man-thing!"

effects.description:
Ability: "Concealment Bombs" for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Most of the other clans struggle to find the patience to deal with such things as 'paperwork' – another weakness that Clan Eshin ruthlessly exploits!

effects.description:
Hero and Lord recruit rank: +3
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: They cannot hit what isn't there.
Time and time again, Snikch has proven that no wall, no castle and no hidden hole will save you from his Weeping Blades.

effects.description:
modifies attrition suffered by defender but in a hidden way.
	(local region)
Immediately causes siege attrition at a reduced rate when besieging enemy settlements

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
As you might expect, the forces of order are repelled by the Skaven and their myriad disgusting, disease-ridden ways.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Lizardmen
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Lizardmen, Dwarfs, High Elves, Greenskins and Men

skillTree.localised_description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

ui_effects.localised_text: ➕ Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
Snikch leaves his distinctive symbol traced in blood beside his victims, so others will know the Deathmaster is abroad, and live in mortal dread.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +5% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +7% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +7% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Night Runners and Gutter Runners units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing exactly where and when to strike is essential when fielding fiendish, potentially battle-winning plague-weapons.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +8% for Skaven Weapon Team units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Skaven Weapon Team units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +7% for Skaven Weapon Team units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Skaven Weapon Team units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Skaven Weapon Team units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and thread…

Charge bonus: +6 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror and Hell Pit Abomination units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +7% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror and Hell Pit Abomination units

Charge bonus: +12 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror and Hell Pit Abomination units

skillTree.localised_description: This one's intimate knowledge of the inner workings of Skaven machinery enables him to improve their efficiency on the battlefield.

Charge bonus: +6% for Doomwheel and Doom-Flayers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +5% for Doomwheels, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 10% for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

effects.description:
Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Gutter Runners, Night Runners, Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +15% for Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Infantry: +5 for Doomwheel, Doom-Flayers and Warp-Grinders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Skaven Weapon Team, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Magic resistance: 15% for Skaven Weapon Team, Doom-Flayer, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Skaven Weapon Team, Doom-Flayers, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 15% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere – even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle – spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.description: Vanguard Deployment||This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Regardless of the mark, Snikch always finds a way to get close. Regardless of the Nightlord’s motives, the Deathmaster always sees his master's will done.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 for embedded Heroes
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: With a poisoned sword in both hands and his own tail, few warriors can survive long against the Deathmaster.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 for Gutter Runners, Night Runners, Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: Woven from stolen human hair and spider silk, the cloak both conceals and silences the wearer, making Snikch near invisible in darkness.
